fields.headline: Goldman Sach's third-quarter profit leaps 83%
fields.bodyText: Strong trading revenue and fees from advising companies on mergers and acquisitions helped fuel profits at Goldman Sachs in the third quarter. Goldmans reported an 83% rise in profits to $1.6bn (£900m) amid signs that Wall Street is coming out of the doldrums. The firm announced plans to buy back $7bn worth of shares. Chairman and chief executive Hank Paulson said the firm experienced "increased activity levels" across all its major businesses in the third quarter and had an optimistic outlook. Goldman has been ranked number one in the mergers and acquisitions tables.
